intro: The best gift you can give us is your presence at our wedding but we appreciate that some people might like to give a gift to mark the occasion.
After 10 years we don’t need much from a traditional gift list but financial contributions seemed to take away the personal touch… so we’ve gone for something in between!

We’ve come up with a few ideas that we think will enhance married life or be something special to remind us of our wedding. We’ll do the actual purchasing of any gifts but if you’d like to contribute then the BACS details are below.

Some of the gifts don’t have a monetary value, but for those that do, there’s no need to cover the full cost. Just let us know in the reference or message what you'd like your gift to go towards so we can hold you in mind when we do or use that thing!

gifts.title: Feed our cat
gifts.details: Making sure Arya has food and cuddles whilst we’re on honeymoon.

gifts.title: Date day: Glass blowing
gifts.details: Day in Bath learning new skills. What could go wrong?

gifts.title: Dessert
gifts.details: Your speciality pudding to put on the dessert table at the wedding.

gifts.title: Cheese & Wine date night
gifts.details: For a fantastically unhealthy date night!

gifts.title: Date day: Fish & Chips
gifts.details: Because a beach walk isn't complete without them.

gifts.title: Shed, just a shed
gifts.details: Its a shed, for doing shed things in.

gifts.title: Tidying up (after wedding)
gifts.details: Volunteer with the tidying up crew on Sunday, snacks will be provided.

gifts.title: Sunset boat trip on Honeymoon
gifts.details: For impulse boat trips on honeymoon.

gifts.title: A piece of your craft or art work
gifts.details: To be displayed with pride in our home forever(ish).

gifts.title: Candle sticks
gifts.details: You stick candle in them. I'm sure they're useful.

gifts.title: Bell tent wood burning stove
gifts.details: When it comes to fire in tents, DIY is probably not advisable.
